$eref.description: The ​binary data type represents a sequence of bytes. In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, for all properties that use the binary type, the property name MUST end with '_bin'. The JSON MTI serialization represents this as a base64-Â­encoded string as specified in RFC4648​. Other serializations SHOULD use a native binary type, if available.
$eref.title: binary

description: Common properties and behavior across all Cyber Observable Objects.
title: cyber-observable-core

$eref.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs
$eref.title: dictionary

___extensions.description: Specifies any extensions of the object, as a dictionary.

___type.description: Indicates that this object is an Observable Object. The value of this property MUST be a valid Observable Object type name, but to allow for custom objects this has been removed from the schema.

___granular_markings.description: The set of granular markings that apply to this object.

$eref.description: The granular-marking type defines how the list of marking-definition objects referenced by the marking_refs property to apply to a set of content identified by the list of selectors in the selectors property.
$eref.title: granular-marking

___selectors.description: A list of selectors for content contained within the STIX object in which this property appears.

___lang.description: Identifies the language of the text identified by this marking.

allOf.description: The marking_ref property specifies the ID of the marking-definition object that describes the marking.

___is_defanged.description: Defines whether or not the data contained within the object has been defanged.

___object_marking_refs.description: The list of marking-definition objects to be applied to this object.

$eref.description: Represents identifiers across the CTI specifications. The format consists of the name of the top-level object being identified, followed by two dashes (--), followed by a UUIDv4.
$eref.title: identifier

___spec_version.description: The version of the STIX specification used to represent the content in this cyber-observable.

$eref.description: Represents identifiers across the CTI specifications. The format consists of the name of the top-level object being identified, followed by two dashes (--), followed by a UUIDv4.
$eref.title: identifier

___id.description: Specifies the identifier of the observable object, as a string.
